The U: S. Government Accountability Office (GAO) report from February 2011 provided data stating that in fiscal year 2009, 24 federal agencies reported 45,190 underutilized buildings that cost $1.66 billion annually to operate.
The General Services Administration: GSA) yearly property reports confirmed the numbers provided by the GAO report, stating that the number of underutilized buildings was 43,360 in fiscal year 2008 and 45,190 in fiscal year 2009.
President Barack Obama issued a memorand: aiming to save at least $3 billion by fiscal year 2012.
The Excess Federal Building and Property: or HR 665, was passed by the U.S. House of Representatives and aimed to create a pilot program that would streamline the process of selling government buildings.
